p: There was a significant effect of temperature and depth/clade, respectively on AP 15N symbiont (SLS; all p < 0.002; Fig. 1c, d). Within each temperature treatment, Symbiodinium hosted by deep/C7 hosts assimilated more 15N than their shallow/A3 counterparts. At 26 °C Symbiodinium from deep/C7 corals were 39% more enriched in 15N than shallow/A3 corals from the same treatment (two-tailed t = −2.4, d f = 36, p = 0.022; Fig. 1c). Similarly, at 31 °C Symbiodinium from deep/C7 corals were 37% more enriched in 15N than their shallow/A3 counterparts from the same treatment (two-tailed t = −3.1, d f = 36, p = 0.004; Fig. 1c).
